intro: Heleastrum spinulosum, commonly known as the prickly heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a rough or hairy texture. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
